TextView.android:text: Maternal Recall Survey
Country Code
Section II.1 ACS
Do you know if your baby was born too soon or too early?
If No , were you at any point at risk of having your baby born too early?
If YES, how many days/week/months too early?
Were you given any madicine or injection?
Do you know what the medicine or injection was for?
What medicine were you given?
How was the medicine given?
How many times were you given the mdecine?
How long before your baby was born did you receive the last dose/
Section II.2 Uterotonics
Were you given any medicine just after the delivery of your baby?
If Yes, how was the medicine given?

RadioButton.android:text: Injection in your thigh or buttocks
Tablets to swallow or hold in your mouth

TextView.android:text: If Yes, when was the injection/tablets given?
Did the health worker tell you that you were going to given an injection/medication?
Do you know what medication/drug you were given?
Were you told the reason for the injection?
If YES,what was the reason?
Don’t know/don’t remember
Section II.3 Essential Newborn Care Practices
Was your baby wiped dry within a few minutes after birth?
After the birth, was the baby put on your chest?
If YES. what time aws the baby placed against your chest?
How long after the birth was the baby bathed for the first time?
Was your baby wrapped in or covered by a towel or cloth immediately after birth?
Was the baby wrapped in a towel or cloth while lyin against your chest?
If NO, was the baby s bare skin touching your bare skin while lying against your chest?
If BARE AGAINST YOUR SKIN, was your baby covered with a towel or cloth while lying against your skin?
Did you breastfeed your baby?
If YES, when did you first try to breastfeed your baby?
Were you given any support with breastfeeding from health workers?
Was your baby given anything else to drink?
Section II.4 Newborn Resuscitation
Did you hear your baby cry immediately after birth?
Did your baby have trouble breathing at birth?
If yes, was anything done to help your baby breathe?
Was your baby’s back vigorously rubbed with a cloth or towel or any other stimulation to help to get your baby to breathe?
Did anyone suction your baby’s mouth or nose after birth to clean the airways?
Did anyone use a plastic device to help your baby breathe?
If your baby didn’t breathe and needed help to breathe, was your baby they ill afterwards?
If yes, how was your baby ill?

RadioButton.android:text: Do not know/ Do not remember

TextView.android:text: Were any other actions taken by the health worker to help your baby to breathe?
Did anyone explain to you what happened to your baby?
If YES, what were you told happened?
Don’t know/don’t remember
Section II.5 Cord care and chlorhexidine cord cleansing
Was anything applied to the stump of the
If YES, what was applied to the cord? (Show tube)?

RadioButton.android:text: Do not know/ Do not remember

TextView.android:text: How long after the cord was cut was
For how many days was chlorhexidine applied to the stump?
How many times per day was chlorhexidine applied to the stump: once a day, twice a day, three times a day, or four or more times a day?
If chlorhexidine was applied, who applied the treatment within the last 24hours?
Did you give consent?
Were you told the reason why the treatment was being applied to the stump?
35a. If YES, what was the reason?
Were you given the medicine to take home?
